member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle
member.summary: cufftHandle is a handle type used to store and access CUFFT plans.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle.Create
member.summary: Creates only an opaque handle, and allocates small data structures on the host. The cufftMakePlan*() calls actually do the plan generation. It is recommended that cufftSet*() calls, such as cufftSetCompatibilityMode(), that may require a plan to be broken down and re-generated, should be made after cufftCreate() and before one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle.SetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: SetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle.SetAutoAllocation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle.SetStream(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUstream)
member.summary: Associates a CUDA stream with a CUFFT plan. All kernel launches made during plan execution are now done through the associated stream, enabling overlap with activity in other streams (for example, data copying). The association remains until the plan is destroyed or the stream is changed with another call to SetStream().
member.param: A valid CUDA stream created with cudaStreamCreate() (or 0 for the default stream)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle.SetCompatibilityMode(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility)
member.summary: configures the layout of CUFFT output in FFTW‐compatible modes. When FFTW compatibility is desired, it can be configured for padding only, for asymmetric complex inputs only, or to be fully compatible.
member.param: The option to be used

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftType.Z2Z
member.summary: Double-Complex to Double-Complex

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility
member.summary: Certain R2C and C2R transforms go much more slowly when FFTW memory layout and behaviour is required. The default is "best performance", which means not-compatible-with-fftw. Use the API to enable exact FFTW-like behaviour.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility.NATIVE
member.summary: Disable any FFTW compatibility mode

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility.PADDING
member.summary:
Inserts extra padding between packed in-place transforms for batched transforms with power-of-2 size.
Default value

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility.ASYMMETRIC
member.summary: Guarantees FFTW-compatible output for non-symmetric complex inputs for transforms with power-of-2 size. This is only useful for artificial (i.e. random) datasets as actual data will always be symmetric if it has come from the real plane. If you don't understand what this means, you probably don't have to use it.

member.name: F:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility.ALL
member.summary: Enable full FFTW compatibility.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan1D.GetSize
member.summary: This call gives a more accurate estimate of the work area size required for a plan than cufftEstimate1d(), given the specified parameters, and taking into account any plan settings that may have been made.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan1D.EstimateSize(System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftType,System.Int32)
member.summary: During plan execution, CUFFT requires a work area for temporary storage of intermediate results. This call returns an estimate for the size of the work area required, given the specified parameters, and assuming default plan settings. Note that changing some plan settings, such as compatibility mode, may alter the size required for the work area.
member.param: The transform size (e.g. 256 for a 256-point FFT)
The transform data type (e.g., CUFFT_C2C for single precision complex to complex)
Number of transforms of size nx

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan1D.GetActualSize
member.summary: Once plan generation has been done, either with the original API or the extensible API, this call returns the actual size of the work area required to support the plan. Callers who choose to manage work area allocation within their application must use this call after plan generation, and after any cufftSet*() calls subsequent to plan generation, if those calls might alter the required work space size.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan1D.SetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: SetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan1D.SetAutoAllocation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.GetSize
member.summary: This call gives a more accurate estimate of the work area size required for a plan than cufftEstimate1d(), given the specified parameters, and taking into account any plan settings that may have been made.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.EstimateSize(System.Int32,System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftType)
member.summary: During plan execution, CUFFT requires a work area for temporary storage of intermediate results. This call returns an estimate for the size of the work area required, given the specified parameters, and assuming default plan settings. Note that changing some plan settings, such as compatibility mode, may alter the size required for the work area.
member.param: The transform size in the x dimension (number of rows)
The transform size in the y dimension (number of columns)
The transform data type (e.g., CUFFT_C2C for single precision complex to complex)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.GetActualSize
member.summary: Once plan generation has been done, either with the original API or the extensible API, this call returns the actual size of the work area required to support the plan. Callers who choose to manage work area allocation within their application must use this call after plan generation, and after any cufftSet*() calls subsequent to plan generation, if those calls might alter the required work space size.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.SetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: SetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.SetAutoAllocation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.TransformDirection)
member.summary: Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform.
member.param: Only unsed for transformations where direction is not implicitly given by type

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.TransformDirection)
member.summary: Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. This method does an in‐place transform.
member.param: Only unsed for transformations where direction is not implicitly given by type

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary:
Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform.
This method is only valid for transform types where transorm direction is implicitly given by the type (i.e. not C2C and not Z2Z)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary:
Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. This method does an in‐place transform.
This method is only valid for transform types where transorm direction is implicitly given by the type (i.e. not C2C and not Z2Z)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.SetStream(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUstream)
member.summary: Associates a CUDA stream with a CUFFT plan. All kernel launches made during plan execution are now done through the associated stream, enabling overlap with activity in other streams (for example, data copying). The association remains until the plan is destroyed or the stream is changed with another call to SetStream().
member.param: A valid CUDA stream created with cudaStreamCreate() (or 0 for the default stream)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan2D.SetCompatibilityMode(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility)
member.summary: configures the layout of CUFFT output in FFTW‐compatible modes. When FFTW compatibility is desired, it can be configured for padding only, for asymmetric complex inputs only, or to be fully compatible.

member.param: The transform size in the x dimension
The transform size in the y dimension
The transform size in the z dimension
The transform data type (e.g., CUFFT_C2C for single precision complex to complex)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan3D.GetActualSize
member.summary: Once plan generation has been done, either with the original API or the extensible API, this call returns the actual size of the work area required to support the plan. Callers who choose to manage work area allocation within their application must use this call after plan generation, and after any cufftSet*() calls subsequent to plan generation, if those calls might alter the required work space size.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan3D.SetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: SetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan3D.SetAutoAllocation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan3D.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.TransformDirection)
member.summary: Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform.
member.param: Only unsed for transformations where direction is not implicitly given by type

member.summary: Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. This method does an in‐place transform.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan3D.SetStream(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUstream)
member.summary: Associates a CUDA stream with a CUFFT plan. All kernel launches made during plan execution are now done through the associated stream, enabling overlap with activity in other streams (for example, data copying). The association remains until the plan is destroyed or the stream is changed with another call to SetStream().
member.param: A valid CUDA stream created with cudaStreamCreate() (or 0 for the default stream)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlan3D.SetCompatibilityMode(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility)
member.summary: configures the layout of CUFFT output in FFTW‐compatible modes. When FFTW compatibility is desired, it can be configured for padding only, for asymmetric complex inputs only, or to be fully compatible.
member.param: The option to be used

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany
member.summary:
Creates a FFT plan configuration of dimension rank, with sizes specified in the array n. The batch input parameter tells CUFFT how many transforms to configure in parallel. With this function, batched plans of any dimension may be created.
Input parameters inembed, istride, and idist and output parameters onembed, ostride, and odist will allow setup of noncontiguous input data in a future version (Beta status in version 4.0). Note that for CUFFT 3.0, these parameters are ignored and the layout of batched data must be side‐by‐side and not interleaved.

member.summary: This call gives a more accurate estimate of the work area size required for a plan than cufftEstimate1d(), given the specified parameters, and taking into account any plan settings that may have been made.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany.EstimateSize(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftType,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: During plan execution, CUFFT requires a work area for temporary storage of intermediate results. This call returns an estimate for the size of the work area required, given the specified parameters, and assuming default plan settings. Note that changing some plan settings, such as compatibility mode, may alter the size required for the work area.
member.param: Dimensionality of the transform (1, 2, or 3)
An array of size rank, describing the size of each dimension
Batch size for this transform
Transform data type (e.g., C2C, as per other CUFFT calls)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany.GetActualSize
member.summary: Once plan generation has been done, either with the original API or the extensible API, this call returns the actual size of the work area required to support the plan. Callers who choose to manage work area allocation within their application must use this call after plan generation, and after any cufftSet*() calls subsequent to plan generation, if those calls might alter the required work space size.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany.SetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: SetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany.SetAutoAllocation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany.SetStream(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUstream)
member.summary: Associates a CUDA stream with a CUFFT plan. All kernel launches made during plan execution are now done through the associated stream, enabling overlap with activity in other streams (for example, data copying). The association remains until the plan is destroyed or the stream is changed with another call to SetStream().

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany.SetCompatibilityMode(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility)
member.summary: configures the layout of CUFFT output in FFTW‐compatible modes. When FFTW compatibility is desired, it can be configured for padding only, for asymmetric complex inputs only, or to be fully compatible.

member.summary:
Creates a FFT plan configuration of dimension rank, with sizes specified in the array n. The batch input parameter tells CUFFT how many transforms to configure in parallel. With this function, batched plans of any dimension may be created.
Input parameters inembed, istride, and idist and output parameters onembed, ostride, and odist will allow setup of noncontiguous input data in a future version (Beta status in version 4.0). Note that for CUFFT 3.0, these parameters are ignored and the layout of batched data must be side‐by‐side and not interleaved.
member.param: Pointer to a object
Dimensionality of the transform (1, 2, or 3)
An array of size rank, describing the size of each dimension
Pointer of size rank that indicates the storage dimensions of the input data in memory
Defines the distance between two successive input elements in the least significant (i.e., innermost) dimension
Indicates the distance between the first element of two consecutive batches in the input data
Pointer of size rank that indicates the storage dimensions of the output data in memory
Defines the distance between two successive output elements in the output array in the least significant (i.e., innermost) dimension
Indicates the distance between the first element of two consecutive batches in the output data
Transform data type (e.g., C2C, as per other CUFFT calls)
Batch size for this transform

The cufftPlanMany() API supports more complicated input and output data layouts via the advanced data layout parameters: inembed, istride, idist, onembed, ostride, and odist.

The transform size in the y dimension (number of columns)
The transform data type (e.g., CUFFT_C2R for single precision complex to real)
Pointer to the size of the work space

member.summary:
During plan execution, CUFFT requires a work area for temporary storage of intermediate results. This call returns an estimate for the size of the work area required, given the specified parameters, and assuming default plan settings. Note that changing some plan settings, such as compatibility mode, may alter the size required for the work area.
The cufftPlanMany() API supports more complicated input and output data layouts via the advanced data layout parameters: inembed, istride, idist, onembed, ostride, and odist.
All arrays are assumed to be in CPU memory.

Array of size rank, describing the size of each dimension

Indicates the distance between the first element of two consecutive signals in a batch of the input data
Pointer of size rank that indicates the storage dimensions of the output data in memory. If set to NULL all other advanced data layout parameters are ignored.
Indicates the distance between two successive output elements in the output array in the least significant (i.e., innermost) dimension
Indicates the distance between the first element of two consecutive signals in a batch of the output data
The transform data type (e.g., CUFFT_R2C for single precision real to complex)
Batch size for this transform
Pointer to the size of the work space

member.summary: Once plan generation has been done, either with the original API or the extensible API, this call returns the actual size of the work area required to support the plan. Callers who choose to manage work area allocation within their application must use this call after plan generation, and after any cufftSet*() calls subsequent to plan generation, if those calls might alter the required work space size.
member.param: cufftHandle object
Pointer to the size of the work space

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftSetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: cufftSetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.
member.param: cufftHandle object
Pointer to workArea

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftSetAutoAllocation(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,System.Int32)
member.summary: cufftSetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.
member.param: cufftHandle object
Boolean to indicate whether to allocate work area.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftDestroy(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle)
member.summary: Frees all GPU resources associated with a CUFFT plan and destroys the internal plan data structure. This function should be called once a plan is no longer needed to avoid wasting GPU memory.
member.param: The object of the plan to be destroyed.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftExecC2C(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.TransformDirection)
member.summary: Executes a CUFFT single‐precision complex‐to‐complex transform plan as specified by direction. CUFFT uses as input data the GPU memory pointed to by the idata parameter. This function stores the Fourier coefficients in the odata array. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform.
member.param: The object of the plan to be destroyed.
cuFloatComplex: Pointer to the single-precision complex input data (in GPU memory) to transform
cuFloatComplex: Pointer to the single-precision complex output data (in GPU memory)
The transform direction: Forward or Inverse

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftExecR2C(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: executes a CUFFT single‐precision real‐to‐complex (implicitly forward) transform plan. CUFFT uses as input data the GPU memory pointed to by the idata parameter. This function stores the nonredundant Fourier coefficients in the odata array. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform (See “CUFFT Transform Types” on page 4 for details on real data FFTs.)
member.param: The object of the plan to be destroyed.
cuFloatReal: Pointer to the single-precision real input data (in GPU memory) to transform
cuFloatComplex: Pointer to the single-precision complex output data (in GPU memory)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftExecC2R(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: Executes a CUFFT single‐precision complex‐to‐real (implicitly inverse) transform plan. CUFFT uses as input data the GPU memory pointed to by the idata parameter. The input array holds only the nonredundant complex Fourier coefficients. This function stores the real output values in the odata array. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform. (See “CUFFT Transform Types” on page 4 for details on real data FFTs.)
member.param: The object of the plan to be destroyed.
cuFloatComplex: Pointer to the single-precision complex input data (in GPU memory) to transform
cuFloatReal: Pointer to the single-precision real output data (in GPU memory)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftSetStream(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUstream)
member.summary: Associates a CUDA stream with a CUFFT plan. All kernel launches made during plan execution are now done through the associated stream, enabling overlap with activity in other streams (for example, data copying). The association remains until the plan is destroyed or the stream is changed with another call to cufftSetStream().
member.param: The object of the plan to be destroyed.
A valid CUDA stream created with cudaStreamCreate() (or 0 for the default stream)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTNativeMethods.cufftSetCompatibilityMode(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.cufftHandle,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility)
member.summary: configures the layout of CUFFT output in FFTW‐compatible modes. When FFTW compatibility is desired, it can be configured for padding only, for asymmetric complex inputs only, or to be fully compatible.
member.param: The object of the plan to be destroyed.
The option to be used

member.name: T:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64
member.summary:
Creates a FFT plan configuration of dimension rank, with sizes specified in the array n. The batch input parameter tells CUFFT how many transforms to configure in parallel. With this function, batched plans of any dimension may be created.
Input parameters inembed, istride, and idist and output parameters onembed, ostride, and odist will allow setup of noncontiguous input data in a future version (Beta status in version 4.0). Note that for CUFFT 3.0, these parameters are ignored and the layout of batched data must be side‐by‐side and not interleaved.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.GetSize
member.summary: This call gives a more accurate estimate of the work area size required for a plan than cufftEstimate1d(), given the specified parameters, and taking into account any plan settings that may have been made.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.GetActualSize
member.summary: Once plan generation has been done, either with the original API or the extensible API, this call returns the actual size of the work area required to support the plan. Callers who choose to manage work area allocation within their application must use this call after plan generation, and after any cufftSet*() calls subsequent to plan generation, if those calls might alter the required work space size.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.SetWorkArea(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary: SetWorkArea() overrides the work area pointer associated with a plan. If the work area was auto-allocated, CUFFT frees the auto-allocated space. The cufftExecute*() calls assume that the work area pointer is valid and that it points to a contiguous region in device memory that does not overlap with any other work area. If this is not the case, results are indeterminate.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.SetAutoAllocation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetAutoAllocation() indicates that the caller intends to allocate and manage work areas for plans that have been generated. CUFFT default behavior is to allocate the work area at plan generation time. If cufftSetAutoAllocation() has been called with autoAllocate set to "false" prior to one of the cufftMakePlan*() calls, CUFFT does not allocate the work area. This is the preferred sequence for callers wishing to manage work area allocation.

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.TransformDirection)
member.summary: Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform.
member.param: Only unsed for transformations where direction is not implicitly given by type

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.TransformDirection)
member.summary: Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. This method does an in‐place transform.
member.param: Only unsed for transformations where direction is not implicitly given by type

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr,ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary:
Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. If idata and odata are the same, this method does an in‐place transform.
This method is only valid for transform types where transorm direction is implicitly given by the type (i.e. not C2C and not Z2Z)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.Exec(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUdeviceptr)
member.summary:
Executes a CUFTT transorm as defined by the cufftType. This method does an in‐place transform.
This method is only valid for transform types where transorm direction is implicitly given by the type (i.e. not C2C and not Z2Z)

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.SetStream(ManagedCuda.BasicTypes.CUstream)
member.summary: Associates a CUDA stream with a CUFFT plan. All kernel launches made during plan execution are now done through the associated stream, enabling overlap with activity in other streams (for example, data copying). The association remains until the plan is destroyed or the stream is changed with another call to SetStream().

member.name: M:ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.CudaFFTPlanMany64.SetCompatibilityMode(ManagedCuda.CudaFFT.Compatibility)
member.summary: configures the layout of CUFFT output in FFTW‐compatible modes. When FFTW compatibility is desired, it can be configured for padding only, for asymmetric complex inputs only, or to be fully compatible.
